title: Official Introduction - The General Union of Yemeni Students in Hungary
content:
The General Union of Yemeni Students in Hungary is the official representative and organizational umbrella of Yemeni students before Hungarian universities, official institutions, and the Yemeni embassy. It stands as a strong cultural bridge linking Yemeni students in Hungary with their homeland and carrying their academic and humanitarian mission with confidence and responsibility.

The Union believes that students are the cornerstone of development and the makers of the future. It works to provide a supportive environment that strengthens the spirit of cooperation and belonging, encourages academic excellence, and promotes positive cultural integration. It seeks to build a professional, organized student body that uplifts students academically, culturally, and socially, protects their rights, and represents them in a way that reflects the diligence and excellence of Yemeni students in Hungary. The Union offers reception services for new students, academic guidance, and cultural and social activities that bring people closer and unite them, operating on the principles of volunteerism, integrity, transparency, and full respect for Hungarian laws and academic regulations.

Through its ambitious vision and ongoing strategy, the Union aims to:
- Build a strong network of relations between Yemeni students and Hungarian academic institutions.
- Promote cultural awareness and highlight Yemeni identity and its positive impact on the international community.
- Support new students in overcoming the initial challenges of academic and daily life in Hungary.
- Empower students to develop their academic and leadership skills through training programs and workshops.
- Maintain sustainable communication with official Yemeni authorities to organize academic affairs and address challenges faced by scholarship students.

The Union believes in partnership rather than guardianship and in collective responsibility rather than individual action. It places cooperation as the foundation for progress and excellence as the standard of achievement, seeking to represent all students fairly and recognize their efforts. It understands that every student has a success story worth telling, and these stories are building blocks in the edifice of Yemeni student work in the diaspora.

The Union does not see itself merely as a student administration, but as an extension of a national and cultural mission, representing a generation of Yemeni youth determined to be ambassadors of knowledge and noble values. It works with a united team spirit across academic, cultural, media, and social committees that form the Union‚Äôs framework.

The General Union of Yemeni Students in Hungary prides itself on its growing relationships with higher education institutions in Budapest and other cities, as well as with Arab communities and international student organizations. It views this openness as a means to establish a distinctive experience in organized student work based on human principles and mutual respect, emphasizing transparency and accountability in all administrative and financial activities while prioritizing students‚Äô interests.

The Union invites every Yemeni student in Hungary to join this large home ‚Äî a home of pride, knowledge, and belonging. It is not merely an administrative institution, but a small homeland that embraces the sons and daughters of Yemen in their diaspora and strengthens their determination toward a better future for themselves and their country.

terms.title: Terms of Service - GUYSH
terms.subtitle: General Union for Yemeni Students in Hungary

section_1.title: Acceptance of Terms
section_1.content: By using this website and creating an account, you agree to be bound by these terms. You must be 18 years or older, or have parental consent. You have the legal capacity to enter this agreement.

section_2.title: Eligibility
section_2.content: The service is exclusively for Yemeni students studying in Hungary. Users are subject to eligibility verification. The union reserves the right to deny service for any reason.

section_3.title: Account Registration
section_3.content: Please provide accurate and up-to-date information when registering. One account per person is allowed. Users are responsible for maintaining password security and not sharing accounts.

section_4.title: Membership
section_4.content: Membership duration is six months, renewable. Membership is currently free. Members receive benefits such as airport pickup coordination, guidance services, and event participation. Renewal follows established procedures.

section_5.title: Services Provided
section_5.content: Services include airport pickup coordination, guidance, and information sharing. All services are provided on a best-effort basis and are not guaranteed. The union is not liable for service delays or unavailability.

section_6.title: User Conduct
items: Providing false information.
Harassment, hate speech, or unauthorized advertising.
Attempting security breaches or violating others‚Äô privacy.
Any illegal acts.

section_7.title: Intellectual Property
section_7.content: The union owns the content and design of the platform. User-generated content remains the user‚Äôs property, but by posting, users grant the union a license to display it. Logos and trademarks are protected.

section_8.title: Service Modifications
section_8.content: The union may modify or discontinue services with notice. These terms may be updated with notification to users.

section_9.title: Account Termination
section_9.content: Users may delete their accounts at any time. The union may suspend or terminate accounts violating these terms. Data deletion upon termination follows the Privacy Policy.

section_10.title: Disclaimers
section_10.content: Services are provided 'as is' without warranties. The union is not responsible for the accuracy of user-provided information or third-party services such as member-arranged airport pickups.

section_11.title: Limitation of Liability
section_11.content: Union liability is limited to the extent allowed by Hungarian law. Not liable for indirect, consequential, or incidental damages. The maximum liability is the amount paid for the service (if any).

section_12.title: Indemnification
section_12.content: Users agree to indemnify the union from claims arising from their violations.

section_13.title: Dispute Resolution
section_13.content: These terms are governed by Hungarian law. Disputes fall under the jurisdiction of Hungarian courts. Negotiation with good intent is encouraged before legal action.

section_14.title: Contact Information
section_14.content: For questions, contact via email, phone, or the address on the website.

section_15.title: Severability
section_15.content: If any provision is found invalid, the remainder of the terms remain in effect.

section_16.title: Entire Agreement
section_16.content: These terms constitute the entire agreement between the user and the union regarding use of the site and services.

privacy.subtitle: GUYSH ‚Äì General Union for Yemeni Students in Hungary

dataCollected.title: Data Collected
dataCollected.content: We collect the following types of personal data to provide our services and manage your membership:
items: Personal Identifiers: name, residence permit number
Contact Information: email, phone, address
Account Data: username, password hash, login history
Service Requests: airport pickup details, guidance services
User-Generated Content: profile information

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content: We process your data based on the following legal grounds under GDPR:
items: Contract Performance: to provide membership and requested services
Legitimate Interest: to operate and improve the platform and prevent fraud
Consent: for communications and updates
Legal Obligation: compliance with Hungarian and EU laws

purpose.title: Purpose of Data Collection
purpose.content: Your data is collected and used strictly for the following purposes:
items: Membership management and verification
Service delivery (e.g., airport pickup and guidance)
Communication about union activities and events
Platform security and fraud prevention
Legal compliance

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing
dataSharing.content: We do NOT sell or share data for marketing purposes. Data is only shared with necessary third-party processors to operate the service:
items: Email Service Provider: Gmail
Hosting Provider: Hetzner Online GmbH (Germany) ‚Äì GDPR compliant
CDN Provider: Cloudflare Inc. ‚Äì Privacy Shield certified

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain data only as long as necessary for the purpose it was collected:
items: Active members: Data retained during active membership
Inactive members: Data deleted 2 years after last activity or upon request
Service requests: Deleted 30 days after completion
Backups: Retained up to 7 weeks
Audit logs: Retained 1 year for security

yourRights.title: Your Rights under GDPR
yourRights.content: You have the right to exercise the following rights regarding your personal data:
items: Right to Access: request copies of all your data
Right to Rectification: correct inaccurate data
Right to Erasure: delete your account and data
Right to Restrict Processing: limit data usage
Right to Data Portability: receive data in machine-readable format
Right to Object: object to certain processing
Right to Withdraw Consent: for consent-based processing
yourRights.additionalContent: How to Exercise Rights: via email yemitehad.hungary@gmail.com or through the web page. Response Time: within 30 days.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We maintain robust security measures to protect your data, including:
items: Data encrypted in transit (HTTPS/TLS)
Sensitive fields encrypted (phone numbers, residence permit numbers, addresses)
Secure authentication (hashed passwords)
Access controls and permissions
Regular security updates
Secure backups
Staff training on data protection
Incident response plan

internationalTransfers.title: International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Data is hosted in Germany (EU) via Hetzner, meaning there are no transfers outside the EU. Non-EU services have adequate safeguards under Privacy Shield or Standard Contractual Clauses.

cookiesTracking.title: Cookies & Tracking
cookiesTracking.content: No cookies or other tracking technologies are used on this platform.

childrenPrivacy.title: Children‚Äôs Privacy
childrenPrivacy.content: The service is intended for university students (typically 18+). Parental consent is required in some EU countries under age 18. We do not knowingly collect data from children under 16 without parental consent.

dataBreach.title: Data Breach Notification
dataBreach.content: In the event of a data breach, we will notify affected users within 72 hours and notify the Hungarian Data Protection Authority (NAIH) as required by law.

policyChanges.title: Policy Changes
policyChanges.content: Significant changes will be notified by email or platform notification. Continued use after updates means acceptance. The Last updated date is displayed clearly.

rightToComplain.title: Right to Complain
rightToComplain.content: You have the right to file complaints with the Hungarian Data Protection Authority (NAIH).
items: Address: 1055 Budapest, Falk Miksa Street 9‚Äì11
Website: https://naih.hu
Email: ugyfelszolgalat@naih.hu
rightToComplain.additionalContent: Please contact us first to resolve any concerns before escalating to NAIH.

automatedDecision.title: Automated Decision Making
automatedDecision.content: No automated decision-making or profiling is used on this platform.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: For any questions or concerns regarding this policy, please contact us.

union.title: Student Union Rules and Rights
union.subtitle: Understanding your rights and responsibilities as a member of Guysh Hungary Student Union
union.introduction: The Guysh Hungary Student Union is dedicated to supporting Yemeni students in Hungary. This document outlines the rights, responsibilities, and rules that govern our union and its members.

items.title: Right to Representation
items.description: Every member has the right to fair representation and to have their voice heard in union matters and decisions affecting the student community.

items.title: Right to Participate
items.description: Members have the right to participate in all union activities, events, and elections, and to vote on important decisions.

items.title: Right to Support Services
items.description: Access to academic support, career guidance, legal assistance, and welfare services provided by the union.

items.title: Right to Information
items.description: Members have the right to receive timely information about union activities, policies, and services available to them.

items.title: Right to Equal Treatment
items.description: All members are entitled to equal treatment regardless of their university, program of study, or personal background.

items.title: Respect and Integrity
items.description: Members must treat fellow students, union staff, and the broader community with respect and maintain the highest standards of personal integrity.

items.title: Active Participation
items.description: Members are encouraged to actively participate in union activities and contribute to the betterment of the student community.

items.title: Compliance with Rules
items.description: Members must comply with all union rules, policies, and the laws of Hungary and their respective educational institutions.

items.title: Financial Obligations
items.description: Members should fulfill any financial obligations, including membership fees or event contributions, in a timely manner.

items.title: Positive Representation
items.description: Members should represent the union and their community positively in all interactions and maintain the union's reputation.

items.title: Airport Pickup Service
items.description: Assistance with arrival and transportation from the airport to accommodation.

items.title: Academic Support
items.description: Tutoring, study groups, and academic counseling services.

items.title: Cultural Events
items.description: Organization of cultural celebrations and community gatherings.

items.title: Legal Assistance
items.description: Guidance on visa matters, housing contracts, and legal rights.

items.title: Career Development
items.description: Career fairs, workshops, and networking opportunities.

items.title: Social Integration
items.description: Programs to help students integrate into Hungarian society.

benefits.title: Membership Benefits
items: Access to exclusive events and workshops
Networking opportunities with fellow Yemeni students
Priority registration for union services
Discounts on cultural events and activities
Access to the union's resource library
Mentorship programs connecting new and senior students
Emergency support and assistance when needed
Voice in union decision-making processes

conduct.title: Code of Conduct
conduct.content: All members must adhere to the following code of conduct:
items: Respect the diversity of the student community
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
Refrain from discriminatory or harassing behavior
Use union resources responsibly and ethically
Report any violations of union rules or policies
Support fellow students in their academic and personal endeavors
